CartesianPositionController.py

1 #!/usr/bin/env python
2 
3 from PandaController import PandaController
4 import numpy as np
5 import rospy
6 import tf
7 
8 from ros_robotic_skin.srv import getJacobian
9 from sensor_msgs.msg import JointState
10 
11 
12 Q_MIN = np.array([-2.8973, -1.7628, -2.8973, -3.0718, -2.8973, -0.0175, -2.8973])
13 Q_MAX = np.array([+2.8973, +1.7628, +2.8973, -0.0698, +2.8973, +3.7525, +2.8973])
14 Q_MIDDLE = (Q_MIN + Q_MAX) / 2
15 
16 
17 class CartesianPositionController(object):
18  """
19  Cartesian controller built on top of PandaController. clean code
20  """
21 
22  def callback_joint_states(self, data):
23  # The first two components of this array are panda_leftfinger and panda_rightfinger.
24  # We are not interested in their values for the Cartesian Position Controller
25  self.q = np.array(data.position)
26 
27  def __init__(self):
28  self.panda_controller = PandaController()
29  self.tf_listener = tf.TransformListener()
30  self.rate = rospy.Rate(100.0)
31  self.q = np.zeros(9)
32  self.q_dot = np.zeros(7)
33  self.p_gain = 2.5
34  self.error_threshold = 0.01
35  self.secondary_task_gain = 5
36 
37  rospy.on_shutdown(self.return_home)
38 
39  self.position = self.get_current_end_effector_position()
40 
41  rospy.wait_for_service('get_jacobian')
42  self.get_jacobian = rospy.ServiceProxy('get_jacobian', getJacobian)
43  rospy.Subscriber("joint_states", JointState, self.callback_joint_states)
44 
45  def get_current_end_effector_position(self):
46  """
47  Get the current end effector position in cartesian coordinates
48 
49  Returns
50  -------
51  trans : numpy.ndarray
52  3x1 vector containing current end effector position vector
53  """
54  while not rospy.is_shutdown():
55  try:
56  (trans, rot) = self.tf_listener.lookupTransform('world', 'end_effector', rospy.Time(0))
57  return np.array(trans)
58  except (tf.LookupException,
59  tf.ConnectivityException,
60  tf.ExtrapolationException):
61  continue
62 
63  def compute_command_velocity(self, position_desired):
64  """
65  Compute the velocity vector in cartesian coordinates that leads to the Point position_desired at a given time instant.
66 
67  Parameters
68  ----------
69  position_desired : numpy.ndarray
70  3x1 end effector desired position vector
71 
72  Returns
73  -------
74  v: numpy.ndarray
75  6x1 velocity vector in cartesian coordinates
76 
77  """
78  self.error = position_desired - self.position
79 
80  v_trans = self.p_gain * self.error
81  v_rot = np.array([0, 0, 0])
82  v = np.block([v_trans, v_rot])
83  v.shape = (6, 1)
84  return v
85 
86  def compute_command_q_dot(self, v):
87  """
88  Convert cartesian velocity vector to joint space through Jacobian
89 
90  Parameters
91  ----------
92  v : numpy.ndarray
93  6x1 velocity vector in cartesian coordinates
94 
95  Returns
96  -------
97  q_dot : numpy.ndarray
98  7x1 joint velocity vector
99  """
100  # Obtain the Jacobian from the KDL node (jacobian.cpp)
101  Jacobian_message = self.get_jacobian(self.q, 'panda_link8')
102  J = np.array(Jacobian_message.J.J)
103  J.shape = (Jacobian_message.J.rows, Jacobian_message.J.columns)
104 
105  # This controller only controls the translation of the end-effector
106  # This is why we get rid of the rotation columns of the jacobian
107  J = J[:3, :]
108  Jpinv = np.linalg.pinv(J)
109 
110  # The secondary task
111  # The function that we want to minimize is H.
112  # This function is bigger when the distances to the mid-value of the joint is bigger
113  # H = 1/7.0 * sum(((self.q[2:] - Q_MIDDLE) / (Q_MAX - Q_MIDDLE))**2)
114  gradient_H = 2/7.0 * ((self.q[2:] - Q_MIDDLE) / (Q_MAX - Q_MIDDLE))
115 
116  # Compute the general solution for q_dot
117  particular_solution = np.dot(Jpinv, v[:3])
118  homogeneous_solution = -self.secondary_task_gain * np.dot((np.identity(7) - np.dot(Jpinv, J)), gradient_H)
119  homogeneous_solution.shape = (7, 1)
120  q_dot = particular_solution + homogeneous_solution
121  q_dot.shape = (7, 1)
122 
123  return q_dot
124 
125  def go_to_point(self, position_desired):
126  """
127  Move to a point an stop when arrived
128 
129  Parameters
130  ----------
131  position_desired : numpy.ndarray
132  3x1 end effector desired position vector
133  Only position, not orientation
134  """
135  position_desired = np.array(position_desired)
136  self.error = position_desired - self.position
137  while np.linalg.norm(self.error) > self.error_threshold:
138  self.position = self.get_current_end_effector_position()
139  velocity = self.compute_command_velocity(position_desired)
140  self.q_dot = self.compute_command_q_dot(velocity)
141  self.panda_controller.send_velocities(self.q_dot)
142  self.rate.sleep()
143  self.stop()
144  return 0
145 
146  def go_to_points_in_trajectory(self, trajectory):
147  """
148  Move through a series of points and stop when arrived.
149 
150  Parameters
151  ----------
152  trajectory : list
153  List containing as many 3x1 np.ndarray position vectors as desired.
154  Position vectors do not specify rotation
155  """
156  for point in trajectory:
157  self.go_to_point(point)
158  self.rate.sleep()
159  return 0
160 
161  def get_trajectory_points_in_circle_yz_plane(self, r, x0, y0, z0, resolution):
162  # Get trajectory points in a circle at plane x = X, centered at (x0, y0, z0), with radius r
163  """
164  Get trajectory points in a circle at plane x = X, centered at (x0, y0, z0), with radius r
165 
166  Parameters
167  ----------
168  r: float
169  [description]
170  x0: float
171  [description]
172  y0: float
173  [description]
174  z0: float
175  [description]
176  resolution: float
177  [description]
178 
179  Returns
180  -------
181  trajectory: list
182  [description]
183  """
184 
185  trajectory = []
186 
187  for theta in np.arange(0, 2*np.pi, resolution):
188  x = x0
189  y = y0 + r * np.cos(theta)
190  z = z0 + r * np.sin(theta)
191  trajectory.append([x, y, z])
192  return trajectory
193 
194  def stop(self):
195  """
196  Stop all joints
197  """
198  q_dot = np.zeros(7)
199  self.panda_controller.send_velocities(q_dot)
200  return 0
201 
202  def return_home(self):
203  self.stop()
204  self.panda_controller.publish_positions(Q_MIDDLE, 0.4)
205 
206 
207 if __name__ == "__main__":
208 
209  x0 = 0.6
210  y0 = 0.0
211  z0 = 0.5
212  r = 0.45
213  resolution = np.pi / 2
214 
215  # Loop that trajectory
216  cartesian_controller = CartesianPositionController()
217  trajectory = cartesian_controller.get_trajectory_points_in_circle_yz_plane(r, x0, y0, z0, resolution)
218  while not rospy.is_shutdown():
219  cartesian_controller.go_to_points_in_trajectory(trajectory)
